casebody.data:
In the Matter of SUSQUEHANNA SILK MILLS, Debtor. Henry Schniewind, Jr., and Irving Trust Company, as Trustees of Susquehanna Silk Mills, Debtor, Appellants, Mitsui & Co., Ltd., Appellee. No. 444. Circuit Court of Appeals, Second Circuit. June 3, 1935. Breed, Abbott & Morgan, of New York City (Charles H. Tuttle, Sumner Ford, Paris S. Russell, and Gerald J. Craugh, all of New York City, of counsel), for appellants. Putney, Twombly & Hall, of New York City (Lemuel Skidmore, of New York City, of counsel), for appellee.

Before MANTON, L. HAND, and AUGUSTUS N. HAND, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

Order (10 F.Supp. 787) affirmed.
